Hi Ilja,

Thank you for your response. It is JUnit 3.8.1 as a Maven 1.X Plugin.
 We are  trying to split the tests off from the suite and execute them in
another way.


Herbert

                   .com                                                    
                                                                           
                                                                           




Hi Herbert,

the simplest thing would probably be to put them in different suites and
run those in different VMs.

Are you using JUnit 3 or 4?

Cheers, Ilja



herbert.helmstreit@... schrieb:
> Hi junit experts,
>
> how can I exclude groups of tests from being executed at the same time?
>
> Background: We are testing classes that use 3rd party libs which can be
> used from an Applet ("Java Mode") or from an Application ("Native Mode").
> Part of our classes load the lib in "Java Mode" another part in "Native
> Mode".
> Usually this is no problem, because nobody would use both modes at the
same
> time.
> But not with JUnit: If we put the tests into a suite, they fail because
3rd
> party libs
> complain about being loaded in two different modes at the same VM/time.
> TibrvException[error=27,message=Tibrv already open using different
> implementation]
>
> any help is welcome!
>
> Herbert
>
